info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 3:09PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Garfield and southwestern Rio Blanco Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 309 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 29 miles south of Rangely, or 43 miles northwest of Grand Junction, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Garfield and southwestern Rio Blanco Counties. This includes Colorado 139 between mile markers 31 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
